Details: The user has the ability to manipulate some graphical attributes of the visual display.
The user’s input produces changes to the visual display fluidly, with little lag, real-time change is sometimes called dynamic.
Parts of the visual display are linked together and "communicate", i.e. the user's interaction with one plot produces a change in another plot (e.g. linked brushing)
The user can manipulate the underlying mathematical structure behind the visual display, not just its surface-level graphical attributes

Short definition: Change is perceived by a human
Details: There is a back-and-forth between the visual information displayed and the user's perception, cognition, insights, etc...
